subtitle: a merchant once had to Traverse through
a jungle on his own while carrying
certain Goods Three Robbers ambushed him
and seized all that he owned let's kill
him said the first Thief why commit the
sin of killing him the second Thief said
let securely fasten him to a tree they
took the second robbers suggestion left
him to his Destiny and left after a
while the third robber reappeared
released the man from his chains and led
him to the edge of the Woodland along a
road that led to the distantly visible
City the merchant expressed his
gratitude to the thief for his
generosity and humbly requested that he
come with him so that he could properly
compensate him when they got home
however the third robber said I cannot
come with you to the city as I will be
recognized as a robber by the police
[Music]
the Three Robbers represent the three
facets of human nature tamguna was the
first robber to act impulsively rajas
the second Thief displayed the trait of
being dependent on the pleasures of the
sensory world satwa the third Thief
displayed the virtues of kindness and
compassion
Guna a facet of reality has a unique
psychological energetic and emotional
impact on us the outer world is made up
of these gunas which are continually
interacting with one another they are
ever present and both tangible and
intangible things contain them to some
extent gunas are not merely restricted
to human nature and can be understood
broadly
the word Guna in Sanskrit means quality
or attribute when seen in a literal
sense in a general understanding of the
term Guna May refer to the fundamental
characteristic that defines an entity
Guna is the fluidity of water the hot
fire the whiteness of milk and the
sweetness of honey it is the personality
or attitude of a person but defines
their personhood a person may be kind
aggressive punctual lethargic truthful
or have many other traits that are said
to be qualities of that person hence the
concept of gunas as an attribute of a
thing entails that it is dependent on
the object and defines its Essence as
they describe reality they form the
fundamental building blocks of the
universe the material world and the
human personality the gunas determining
the different aspects of Life creation
relationships and knowledge have been
well explored in ancient philosophical
texts broadly they can be seen in the
cosmic aspect as a part of personality
in the societal aspect and from a
rational scientific point of view
nothing
all things in the cosmos exist in
Duality the masculine and feminine the
yin and the Yang the mind and the body
the sankya school of Indian philosophy
visualizes this duality in the form of
purusha and prakriti urusha represents
the conscious but passive aspect of
reality whereas prakriti represents the
unconscious but creative aspect it is
the power that gives birth to everything
gunas are the constituents of this
prakriti they can be classified into
three types
the satwaguna is goodness Bliss and
Enlightenment it is buoyant bright and
Illuminating the rajaguna is the
principle of motion and energy it is
restlessness desire activity effort and
pain tamaguna consists of Darkness
apathy indifference ignorance and
lethargy it is the quality of heaviness
negativity confusion and passivity in
prakriti all three gunas are present in
harmonious balance when prakriti the
feminine comes into contact with purusha
the masculine the equilibrium of the
gunas within prakriti is Disturbed the
rajaguna begins to dominate compelling
other gunas to engage in activity as
well as a result material products start
evolving out of prakriti and krishnakas
each product of creation contains all
three gunas sat Raj and Tam although in
different proportions resulting in the
diversity of the phenomenal world the
plants animals elements of nature and
even human beings show and diversity and
characteristics corresponding to
different combinations of the three
gunas every phenomenon contains a
predominant Guna as well as a smaller
dose of the other two gunas that is why
for instance anger can be transformed
into compassion because the rajasth
state of anger contains some satva the
predominant Gunner of compassion besides
the cosmic explanation given by some can
philosophy gunas have a practical use
they can be said to influence our daily
lives through personal development
understanding relationships and
psychology cultivating habits and
managing our desires
explains the types of personalities due
to the gunas and how one should manage
them
Bruno's not only differentiate between
different characters of people they also
vary in a person throughout their life
and even within a day imagine waking up
early in the morning some people may be
very energetic and remain motivated
throughout the day while Others May find
it difficult to make it out of bed there
is a dominance of rajaguna in the farmer
and tamaguna in the latter a satva Guna
person wakes up feels at peace and
remains grateful for the day she neither
has the mindset of winning the world nor
is she a nihilist the mindset of a
person may change the next minute with
time through different phases of life or
after acquiring new knowledge with three
gunas together shape the personality of
a human being the bhagavad-gita
recognizes the diversity and personality
but at the same time gives a higher
importance to satwaguna in verse 14 and
15 of chapter 14 the bhagavad-gita says
those who die with the predominance of
satwa reach the pure rewards which are
free from rajas and Thomas of the
Learned those who die with the
prevalence of the mode of passion are
born among people driven by work while
those dying in the mode of ignorance
take birth in the animal kingdom the
three gunas cannot be compared among
themselves because each has its own use
satwagona provides spiritual upliftment
an increase in satwaguna is the goal of
spiritual Seekers it shows the correct
path and removes hindrances from it such
as Temptation and material desires as
spiritual path is long and difficult it
requires intense determination
persistence and desire for Moksha that
is provided by rajakuna the tamaguna
keeps a person grounded and avoids harm
as one acts within their limits a yogi
on the other hand should strive to live
as satwik as possible a person with
balanced Gunners might look like this
engaged in Daily yogic practices devoted
to God eats well and surrounds
themselves with good company healthy
rajas which means they get pleasure from
accomplishments family life service and
generosity and healthy Thomas which is a
consistent sleep schedule of rising and
sleeping early one cannot be entirely
composed of any of these gunas as all
three are constantly present in everyone
and everything there are people who are
unkind irresponsible greedy and lazy
they take wrong turns and endanger
themselves and those around them their
personalities are dominated by tamaguna
but with proper guidance Rehabilitation
and motivation they can correct
themselves the this is because of the
inherent satwaguna in them however
minute may be similarly a highly ethical
person should perform her actions
carefully the slightest amount of
immorality can degrade into committing
great injustices due to a slippery slope
all of this is because tamaguna is
present in everyone even revered Saints
excess of rajaguna can lead to unending
desires and excessive hard work this is
noticeable in the current generation's
Trend to work hard today to lead a
comfortable life later this not only
takes a toll on health but also destroys
relationships passions and hobbies it
has to be balanced with both satwa and
tamaguna in order to lead a harmonious
life the bhagavad-gita teaches not only
to move towards satpaguna but later to
even abandon the three gunas in order to
achieve liberation
[Music]
from a sociological standpoint the sap
Raj and tamagunas explain social
divisions and strive for social justice
the societal division based on gunas can
be compared with divisions in Plato's
political philosophy the three divisions
of Guardians auxiliaries and Craftsmen
are based on the dominant traits of
Reason spirit and appetite respectively
these characteristics are the Greek
equivalents of the Indian concepts of
satwa Raja and tamagunas in the Indian
context the dominance of different gunas
led to the Varna system which is based
on divisions based on occupations that
require different gunas to be dominant
in a person in modern Frameworks the
divisions are frequently criticized for
being discriminatory but looking at
these divisions from a philosophical
perspective they aim at achieving
societal Harmony Perfection of actions
and Collective operation it was a novel
Concept in earlier times of turmoil
infighting and wars that promoted a
cohesive Society appetites channeled
through the Artisan class would produce
goods and services Spirit channeled
through the auxiliaries would provide
potential for the defense of the state
reason channeled through the Guardians
could provide for the guidance of
appetite and Spirit in order that the
state be ruled wisely in the interests
of all
when a question is asked what is real it
may lead to a multitude of explanations
and speculations most of these theories
are just philosophical Concepts and do
not correspond to empirical observation
but using the concept of gunas to
explain the reality of phenomena around
us seems more acceptable the qualities
or attributes are entities through which
our senses interact so a description of
reality based on gunas is more cohesive
according to the modern era philosopher
Berkeley when we perceive an apple it is
not the object itself but a set of
qualities such as redness roundness
sweetness Etc that our mind cohesively
interprets as an apple in the nyaya
vaishik philosophy gunas are visualized
as a separate category of reality that
can be conceived and thought good as in
the substance share an Inseparable and
eternal relationship hence substance or
reality cannot be received without gunas
just like an apple cannot be perceived
without redness or sweetness
School recognizes 24 qualities that are
both material and spiritual in nature
Jainism recognizes gunas as Everlasting
attributes that exist in substance and
all its modifications hence describing
reality through gunas makes it rational
consistent and acceptable even the
concept of the Trinity of gunas in
sankya is scientific in the sense that
it is able to explain cosmological
evolution without the use of theological
elements
the whole spiritual discipline of yoga
can be said to be about transforming
thumb balancing Raja and developing
satwa balanced gunas indicate that the
three elements of sat Raj and Tam are in
harmony with each other and that none is
dominant over the others in such a
condition the lightness and calmness of
sat balance the darkness of thumb and
the hyperactivity of Raj through its
promotion of intelligence understanding
Joy Harmony and awareness the ultimate
goal of spiritual practice is to
maximize Supple levels which can in turn
bring greater happiness Clarity and
wisdom into our lives when satwa is
maximized we experience beneficial
changes on all fronts our minds can
think more clearly and gain greater
discernment our actions reflect our
desire to contribute positively to the
world and we become more in tune with
our own internal wants needs desires and
hopes we feel in touch with ourselves in
a world where constant stimulation and
work can leave us feeling alienated
balanced Gunners help in the growth of
personality and character it leads to
physical mental and Spiritual
Development interpersonal relationships
career respect and societal status are
all positively impacted
but how do we achieve this balance if we
find ourselves struggling with excess
rajas and Thomas and the problems
associated with them we need to be aware
of the actions that are causing the
imbalance and make the appropriate
changes major areas of intervention can
be diet lifestyle habits the workplace
environment Leisure and interpersonal
relationships one can pursue satvic
aspects in their lives by opposing Raja
and tamaguna a satwik Diet consists of
freshly cooked vegetables and fresh
fruits as well as a balanced diet that
avoids meat and alcohol Frozen processed
and reheated foods should be avoided in
order to counter tamaguna one should
lead an active lifestyle and exercise
regularly one should keep company with
spiritually minded people practice
compassion and live in a decluttered and
calm environment regular meditation and
reducing sense consumption by
prioritizing desires will help with
rajaguna management once the balance is
achieved the bhagavad-gita speaks of
going beyond the three gunas to achieve
Liberation the Ultimate Reality Brahman
is beyond the three gunas that is
only the realization of identity of
Brahman and the self will grant
Liberation in the verse 24-26 of chapter
14 the bhagavad-gita describes the one
who has left behind the attribution of
gunas those who are alike in happiness
and distress were established in the
self to look upon a Claude a stone and a
piece of gold as of equal value who
remain the same amidst Pleasant and
unpleasant events who are intelligent
who accept both blame and praise with
Equanimity who remain the same in honor
and dishonor who treat both friend and
foe alike and who have abandoned all
Enterprises they are said to have risen
above the three gunas and come to the
level of the Brahman
the idea of the gunas is straightforward
yet it is also a strong and useful
instrument for comprehending and
managing life to create Harmony in
living one should work towards the three
gunas equilibrium
cultivation and Raja and tamagona
control are required for this balance
however one must be prepared to give up
even the satwaguna in order to achieve
the ultimate aim of spiritual progress
known as Moksha even the thief in the
opening narrative who had a satvik
character was unable to enter the city
since in a sense he was a thief
it symbolizes the main idea of the
bhagavad-gita's gunas which is that in
order to obtain spiritual emancipation
one must also transcend the Gunna of
satva none of the gunas can fully
immerse us impurity and bring us to our
purusha essential nature at some point
we must transcend them all and only
exist is that observing consciousness
